verses.verse: Moreover the word <WH1697> of the LORD <WH3068> came to me, saying <WH559>,

Go <WH1980> and cry <WH7121> in the ears <WH241> of Jerusalem <WH3389>, saying <WH559>, Thus saith <WH559> the LORD <WH3068>; I remember <WH2142> thee, the kindness <WH2617> of thy youth <WH5271>, the love <WH160> of thine espousals <WH3623>, when thou wentest <WH3212> after <WH310> me in the wilderness <WH4057>, in a land <WH776> that was not sown <WH2232>.

Israel <WH3478> was holiness <WH6944> unto the LORD <WH3068>, and the firstfruits <WH7225> of his increase <WH8393>: all that devour <WH398> him shall offend <WH816>; evil <WH7451> shall come <WH935> upon them, saith <WH5002> the LORD <WH3068>.
Hear <WH8085> ye the word <WH1697> of the LORD <WH3068>, O house <WH1004> of Jacob <WH3290>, and all the families <WH4940> of the house <WH1004> of Israel <WH3478>:

¶ Thus saith <WH559> the LORD <WH3068>, What iniquity <WH5766> have your fathers <WH1> found <WH4672> in me, that they are gone far <WH7368> from me, and have walked <WH3212> after <WH310> vanity <WH1892>, and are become vain <WH1891>?

Neither said <WH559> they, Where is the LORD <WH3068> that brought us up <WH5927> out of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>, that led <WH3212> us through the wilderness <WH4057>, through a land <WH776> of deserts <WH6160> and of pits <WH7745>, through a land <WH776> of drought <WH6723>, and of the shadow of death <WH6757>, through a land <WH776> that no man <WH376> passed through <WH5674>, and where no man <WH120> dwelt <WH3427>?

And I brought <WH935> you into a plentiful <WH3759> country <WH776>, to eat <WH398> the fruit <WH6529> thereof and the goodness <WH2898> thereof; but when ye entered <WH935>, ye defiled <WH2930> my land <WH776>, and made <WH7760> mine heritage <WH5159> an abomination <WH8441>.

The priests <WH3548> said <WH559> not, Where is the LORD <WH3068>? and they that handle <WH8610> the law <WH8451> knew <WH3045> me not: the pastors <WH7462> also transgressed <WH6586> against me, and the prophets <WH5030> prophesied <WH5012> by Baal <WH1168>, and walked <WH1980> after <WH310> things that do not profit <WH3276>.
¶ Wherefore I will yet plead <WH7378> with you, saith <WH5002> the LORD <WH3068>, and with your children's <WH1121> children <WH1121> will I plead <WH7378>.

For pass over <WH5674> the isles <WH339> of Chittim <WH3794>, and see <WH7200>; and send <WH7971> unto Kedar <WH6938>, and consider <WH995> diligently <WH3966>, and see <WH7200> if there be such a thing.
Hath a nation <WH1471> changed <WH3235> their gods <WH430>, which are yet no gods <WH430>? but my people <WH5971> have changed <WH4171> their glory <WH3519> for that which doth not profit <WH3276>.
Be astonished <WH8074>, O ye heavens <WH8064>, at this, and be horribly afraid <WH8175>, be ye very <WH3966> desolate <WH2717>, saith <WH5002> the LORD <WH3068>.

For my people <WH5971> have committed <WH6213> two <WH8147> evils <WH7451>; they have forsaken <WH5800> me the fountain <WH4726> of living <WH2416> waters <WH4325>, and hewed them out <WH2672> cisterns <WH877>, broken <WH7665> cisterns <WH877>, that can hold <WH3557> no water <WH4325>.
¶ Is Israel <WH3478> a servant <WH5650>? is he a homeborn <WH1004> <WH3211> slave? why <WH4069> is he spoiled <WH957>?

The young lions <WH3715> roared <WH7580> upon him, and yelled <WH5414> <WH6963>, and they made <WH7896> his land <WH776> waste <WH8047>: his cities <WH5892> are burned <WH3341> without inhabitant <WH3427>.
Also the children <WH1121> of Noph <WH5297> and Tahapanes <WH8471> have broken <WH7462> the crown of thy head <WH6936>.
Hast thou not procured <WH6213> this unto thyself, in that thou hast forsaken <WH5800> the LORD <WH3068> thy God <WH430>, when <WH6256> he led <WH3212> thee by the way <WH1870>?

And now what hast thou to do in the way <WH1870> of Egypt <WH4714>, to drink <WH8354> the waters <WH4325> of Sihor <WH7883>? or what hast thou to do in the way <WH1870> of Assyria <WH804>, to drink <WH8354> the waters <WH4325> of the river <WH5104>?

Thine own wickedness <WH7451> shall correct <WH3256> thee, and thy backslidings <WH4878> shall reprove <WH3198> thee: know <WH3045> therefore and see <WH7200> that it is an evil <WH7451> thing and bitter <WH4751>, that thou hast forsaken <WH5800> the LORD <WH3068> thy God <WH430>, and that my fear <WH6345> is not in thee, saith <WH5002> the Lord <WH136> GOD <WH3069> of hosts <WH6635>.

¶ For of old time <WH5769> I have broken <WH7665> thy yoke <WH5923>, and burst <WH5423> thy bands <WH4147>; and thou saidst <WH559>, I will not transgress <WH5674> <WH5647>; when upon every high <WH1364> hill <WH1389> and under every green <WH7488> tree <WH6086> thou wanderest <WH6808>, playing the harlot <WH2181>.

Yet I had planted <WH5193> thee a noble vine <WH8321>, wholly a right <WH571> seed <WH2233>: how then art thou turned <WH2015> into the degenerate plant <WH5494> of a strange <WH5237> vine <WH1612> unto me?

For though thou wash <WH3526> thee with nitre <WH5427>, and take thee much <WH7235> soap <WH1287>, yet thine iniquity <WH5771> is marked <WH3799> before <WH6440> me, saith <WH5002> the Lord <WH136> GOD <WH3069>.

How canst thou say <WH559>, I am not polluted <WH2930>, I have not gone <WH1980> after <WH310> Baalim <WH1168>? see <WH7200> thy way <WH1870> in the valley <WH1516>, know <WH3045> what thou hast done <WH6213>: thou art a swift <WH7031> dromedary <WH1072> traversing <WH8308> her ways <WH1870>;

A wild ass <WH6501> used <WH3928> to the wilderness <WH4057>, that snuffeth up <WH7602> the wind <WH7307> at her pleasure <WH185> <WH5315>; in her occasion <WH8385> who can turn her away <WH7725>? all they that seek <WH1245> her will not weary <WH3286> themselves; in her month <WH2320> they shall find <WH4672> her.

Withhold <WH4513> thy foot <WH7272> from being unshod <WH3182>, and thy throat <WH1627> from thirst <WH6773>: but thou saidst <WH559>, There is no hope <WH2976>: no; for I have loved <WH157> strangers <WH2114>, and after <WH310> them will I go <WH3212>.

As the thief <WH1590> is ashamed <WH1322> when he is found <WH4672>, so is the house <WH1004> of Israel <WH3478> ashamed <WH3001>; they, their kings <WH4428>, their princes <WH8269>, and their priests <WH3548>, and their prophets <WH5030>,

Saying <WH559> to a stock <WH6086>, Thou art my father <WH1>; and to a stone <WH68>, Thou hast brought me forth <WH3205>: for they have turned <WH6437> their back <WH6203> unto me, and not their face <WH6440>: but in the time <WH6256> of their trouble <WH7451> they will say <WH559>, Arise <WH6965>, and save <WH3467> us.

But where are thy gods <WH430> that thou hast made <WH6213> thee? let them arise <WH6965>, if they can save <WH3467> thee in the time <WH6256> of thy trouble <WH7451>: for according to the number <WH4557> of thy cities <WH5892> are thy gods <WH430>, O Judah <WH3063>.
Wherefore will ye plead <WH7378> with me? ye all have transgressed <WH6586> against me, saith <WH5002> the LORD <WH3068>.

In vain <WH7723> have I smitten <WH5221> your children <WH1121>; they received <WH3947> no correction <WH4148>: your own sword <WH2719> hath devoured <WH398> your prophets <WH5030>, like a destroying <WH7843> lion <WH738>.

¶ O generation <WH1755>, see <WH7200> ye the word <WH1697> of the LORD <WH3068>. Have I been a wilderness <WH4057> unto Israel <WH3478>? a land <WH776> of darkness <WH3991>? wherefore say <WH559> my people <WH5971>, We are lords <WH7300>; we will come <WH935> no more unto thee?
Can a maid <WH1330> forget <WH7911> her ornaments <WH5716>, or a bride <WH3618> her attire <WH7196>? yet my people <WH5971> have forgotten <WH7911> me days <WH3117> without number <WH4557>.
Why trimmest <WH3190> thou thy way <WH1870> to seek <WH1245> love <WH160>? therefore hast thou also taught <WH3925> the wicked ones <WH7451> thy ways <WH1870>.

Also in thy skirts <WH3671> is found <WH4672> the blood <WH1818> of the souls <WH5315> of the poor <WH34> innocents <WH5355>: I have not found <WH4672> it by secret search <WH4290>, but upon all these.

Yet thou sayest <WH559>, Because I am innocent <WH5352>, surely his anger <WH639> shall turn <WH7725> from me. Behold, I will plead <WH8199> with thee, because thou sayest <WH559>, I have not sinned <WH2398>.
Why gaddest thou about <WH235> so much <WH3966> to change <WH8138> thy way <WH1870>? thou also shalt be ashamed <WH954> of Egypt <WH4714>, as thou wast ashamed <WH954> of Assyria <WH804>.

Yea, thou shalt go forth <WH3318> from him, and thine hands <WH3027> upon thine head <WH7218>: for the LORD <WH3068> hath rejected <WH3988> thy confidences <WH4009>, and thou shalt not prosper <WH6743> in them.
